#summary Describes how to setup the standard Subversion plugin for Eclipse

= Setting up an SVN plugin for Eclipse =
  # Launch Eclipse.
  # Click *Help*->*Software Updates*-> *Find and Install...*
  # Choose "Search for new features to install". Click *Next*.
  # Add the following new Remote sites:

||Name||Url||
||Buckminster||http://download.eclipse.org/technology/buckminster/updates||
||Subclipse||http://subclipse.tigris.org/update_1.2.x||
||TMate||http://tmate.org/svn/||


  # Select each of the above added sites. Click Finish
  # On the Updates dialog, drop down the *Subclipse*->*Subclipse Plugin*->*Subclipse 1.2.4* feature and select it. Click *Next*. 

http://instinct.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Install_Subclipse.png

  # Accept the license agreement and click *Next*. 
  # Click *Finish* on the installation summary page.
  # On the verification screen choose *Install All*.

http://instinct.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Subclipse_Verification.png

  # On the *Install/Update* screen choose *Yes* to restarting Eclipse.
  # Choose *Windows*->*Preferences*->*Team*->*SVN*. If you get a "Failed to load JavaHL Library" error:

http://instinct.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/JavahHL_Error.png

 You could either install and configure the specified libraries or
 choose *SVNKit (Pure Java)* from under the "SVN Interface" section and click *Apply*.

http://instinct.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Subclipse_installed.png
